meanings.definition: Demonstrating aggression or willingness to fight.
meanings.sent1: The bellicose dog barked loudly at the mailman.
meanings.sent2: The bellicose nation declared war on its neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The bellicose cat hissed at its own reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a bellicose manner, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The bellicose wrestler entered the ring with a fierce look in his eyes.

meanings.definition: Inclined to start quarrels or wars.
meanings.sent1: The bellicose child always picked fights with his classmates.
meanings.sent2: The bellicose ruler sought to expand his empire through conquest.
meanings.sent3: The bellicose squirrel chased away all the other animals from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The bellicose thunder rumbled ominously in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The bellicose driver honked aggressively at the slow-moving car in front of him.
